i disagree, for a city builder that tries hard to take goofiness to a whole new level, it has pretty deep and compelling gameplay. it takes a long time for it to ramp up in the campaign, which i suspect is a turn off for some. if you aren't interested in all the mechanics and just want to satisfy your urge to play the newest thing (for five minutes) then it's definitely not going to be very rewarding.

It seems both versions of Razor1911's torrents seem to suffer from the freezing issues, which is cited in the install notes as "Minor recurring freezes" due to a broken auto-save mechanic. I tried looking into this and found "http://thepiratebay.org/torrent/5639405/The_settlers_7_Autosave_fix_no_crash_for_patch_1.02" which claims it will fix the freezes if your game is patched to v1.02 (This is the patch Razor1911 supplied themselves in my version). However my download for this "fix" always stops at near 89%, it's only like 120 kb so I don't know what the problem is.. Has anyone else figured this out?..
